description: Some free-floating battery charge.  It can be reloaded into rechargeable battery cells, but can never be unloaded.
//: Setting battery volume to 0 causes weirdness in vehicle tests.  Please don't do that.
//2: 1 battery is 1 kJ of energy. 40 batteries is an alkaline C-cell.

description: A common flammable liquid, used in lighters.
//: liquid butane has a density of 573 mg per ml

description: A notch used with a fire drill to create an ember.
Paint that comes in a sealed, pressurized container and is released in an aerosol spray when a valve button is depressed.
Ink comprised of a main carrier solvent, a glyceride, a pyrrolidone, a resin, and a colorant, making it water resistant.
A solid flammable substance, used to make candles.
A pyrotechnic chemical used in flares.
A small stick with a red part at the end.  Strike it against a matchbook to light it.
Compressed medical oxygen.
Compressed hydrogen.
Compressed nitrogen.

Harness the power of radiation in your own home!  It looks similar to a D-cell battery, but actually contains folded layers of radioactive material inside.  It can produce electricity for several years at a steady voltageâ€¦ but it's barely enough to power a small LED, and these batteries were worth hundreds of dollars.  Mostly they're a good way to brag to your neighbors that you have a nuclear power source in your house.

Did your neighbors brag about their cool beta-decay-powered nightlights?  Do them one better!  The CuppaTech 4 radioisotope thermoelectric generator is a three kilogram chunk of metal - mostly lead - with a slug of cerium-244 encased within.  It is capable of generating somewhere between 100-150 Watts of thermal energy, although its electrical generation capacity is minimal at only 2 Watts.  Careful!  Curium is great at making heat, and also releases deadly gamma radiation.  Keep away from cellular life forms.
A sheet of thin foil made of aluminum.  Sometimes called 'tin foil' due to being made of tin in the past.

//: = one cent, gives correct prices for cash cards
description: A unit of currency equivalent to 0.01 US dollars.
A small quantity of thread that could be used for sewing.
//: 50 weight thread - 50m per gram. Each unit is .25m or roughly 10 inches.

description: A tough sinew cut from a corpse, usable as thread.
Tough, thin fiber taken from a plant.  Can be used as thread.
A length of wool yarn that could be used to knit wool clothing.
A cleansing agent shaped into a bar.
A cosmetic preparation used for protecting, moisturizing, and lubricating the skin.

variants.description: A moisturizer that works for all skin types and is really affordable!
A moisturizer that's smooth like milk, just like your skin will be after applying this wonderful product.
A simple moisturizer with all-organic ingredients.
A favorite among customers with sensitive skin.
If you have oily skin, this moisturizer is for you!
After applying this moisturizer, your skin will feel hydrated and smooth.
Using various plants as ingredients, this moisturizer will give your skin all the vitamins it needs for the day.
A moisturizer containing mushroom extract to help improve the wellbeing of your skin.
A favorite among mature customers, this moisturizer will smooth out the wrinkles on your face and make you appear younger.
A moisturizer that works all day and night.  A perfect fit for those that decide their own sleep schedule.

description: A roll of incredibly strong tape.  Its uses are innumerable.
//1: 200 charges - one roll is 20 yards. One charge = 0.1 yard.
//2: Based on https://www.amazon.com/dp/B097HKH3G4, with the assumption that the tape is 1mm thick for volume calculation

description: A thin paper strip intended for the rolling of cigarettes.
A length of plastic-jacketed copper cable, of the type used in small electronics.
//: Calculated off of copper wire with an extra 0.5mm of diameter and 0.66g.

description: A length of copper wire ready to be covered with plastic.
//: Calculated off of 12 AWG, at 10cm length, using http://www.mtlexs.com/technical-specifications-details/40/weight-of-copper-wire.

description: This is neither a fuel cell, nor nuclear, but the name stuck.  It uses plutonium-244 as a catalyst to stabilize a complicated nanocompound that can store enormous amounts of power.  Unfortunately, it cannot be recharged by conventional means: expended cells had to be sent to a central reprocessing facility that almost certainly doesn't exist anymore.
The uranium dioxide (UO2) powder is fired in a high-temperature, sintering furnace to create hard, ceramic pellets of enriched uranium dioxide.
Highly-radioactive slurry.  It is probably best to get far away from this.
Highly-radioactive slurry.  It is probably best to get far away from this.
A baseball wrapped with barbed wire, for when the game turns serious.
A rock the size of a baseball.  Makes a decent melee weapon, and is also good for throwing at enemies.
A small rock, useful as ammunition for a slingshot.
A round projectile made of clay, useful as ammunition for a slingshot.
A glass marble, useful as ammunition for a slingshot.
A steel ball bearing, useful as ammunition for a slingshot.
A small steel ball that can be fired from a BB gun.  Deals virtually no damage.
A feather from a bird.  Useful for fletching arrows.
A fluffy down feather from a bird.  Useful for making cozy bedclothes.
A 120mm high-explosive anti-tank round.  It could ruin anyone's whole day.
A canister of pressurized hydrogen so heavily compressed it has turned solid.  With proper equipment, it could be heated into plasma.

Firearm-quality gunpowder, mixed without concern for composition, burn rate, or shape, making it thoroughly useless for reloading ammunition.  It has been slightly ground to make its properties more uniform.
Firearm-quality gunpowder intended for use in shotgun shells.
Firearm-quality gunpowder intended for use in pistol ammunition.
Firearm-quality gunpowder intended for use in magnum pistol ammunition.
Firearm-quality gunpowder intended for use in rifle ammunition.
Firearm-quality gunpowder intended for use in large rifle ammunition.
Single base smokeless gunpowder intended for use in artillery propelling charges.
Volatile powdered chemical oxidizer.
Powdered caustic soda, also known as sodium hydroxide.
A primer from a shotgun shell.
A primer from a small-caliber pistol round.
A primer from a large-caliber pistol round.
A primer from a small-caliber rifle round.
A primer from a large-caliber rifle round.
A rubber slug from a shotgun beanbag round.  You could use it to make a new beanbag round.
A chunk of useful rubber that can be molded easily.
Some scrap bits of copper.  Could be used to craft things, such as makeshift ammunition.
//: 200*5g / 8.63g/ml = ~115.87ml. Add 10% to take an uneven chunk into account = 127.46ml rounded upwards to 128ml.

description: A roll of semi-opaque medical tape, intended to hold bandages in place.  Not as versatile as duct tape.

//0: about a dollar per kg of charcoal commercially. fetches $0.001 per chunk to survivors
description: A flammable carbon-based material produced by slowly burning wood.  Utilized in recipes requiring a pure, hot flame.  Can also be used in filters to remove contaminants from air and water.
//: 5 ml per chunk, .208 kg/liter for 1040mg per chunk to give it parity with coal, as 5mL charcoal is worth roughly 31kJ (1u of coal)

description: This carbon electrode is basically made from wood and sugar, and it actually works.

//0: about a $0.15 per kg of coal commercially. fetches $0.001 per chunk to survivors
description: Flammable black chunks of carbon-based material, commonly used for cooking and heating.
//: Density somewhere around 0.931 g/cm3 (bulk density of anthracite), roughly 31kJ per unit of coal

description: A bronchodilator that relaxes muscles in the airways and increases air flow to the lungs.

A tiny glass vial filled with advanced fast-healing chemicals which can only be activated by a Rivtech jet injector device.  The packaged instructions describe its efficacy in dealing with infections, wounds, intoxications, envenomations, and general tiredness in enthusiastic detail.  A short safety section at the end warns - in much smaller typeface - against using more than two doses per hour.
A pressurized multi-chamber glass vial filled with powerful chemical stimulants which can only be activated by a Rivtech stimulant delivery system.
A polymer dissolved in solvent, with antiseptic added, for topical treatment of minor cuts and scrapes.

//: About 10 USD per kilogram in current prices.  Density is 2.48 g/cm3, rounded down to account for its granularity, weight is given per 1 minute of scrubbing
description: Granulated mixture of slaked lime, potassium hydroxide and/or sodium hydroxide that is used as CO2 scrubbing agent in rebreathers.
Potassium superoxide powder, used as oxygen regenerating agent in rebreathers.  Keep away from water.
//: Density is 2.14 g/cm3, rounded down to account for it being powder, weight is given per 1 minute of scrubbing

description: A small, replaceable filter cartridge for an air filtration mask.
A medium-sized, replaceable filter cartridge for an air filtration mask.
Liquid made up of propylene glycol, vegetable glycerin, flavorings, and nicotine.  Intended for use in an advanced electronic cigarette.
A handful of bait, used in traps to lure fish.

A hand-built rocket, consisting of a spike welded onto a pipe filled with improvised rocket fuel.  Horribly inaccurate, as can be expected of this grade of weapon, but packs a fierce punchâ€¦ if it hits.
A hand-built rocket, consisting of a simple explosive warhead attached onto a pipe, filled with improvised rocket fuel.  Not very powerful, but can be made from scratch.
A hand-built rocket, consisting of a container of flammable gel attached onto a pipe, filled with improvised rocket fuel.  A short-range incendiary - handle with care!
The result of an interrupted charcoal-making process.  Useless, except as fuel in a charcoal kiln.
A pile of small 3 cm by 6 cm steel rectangles with a pattern of holes drilled into it.  For use in creating or repairing lamellar armor.
//: An individual lamella is roughly 3cm x 6cm x 1mm in size.

description: A pile of small 3 cm by 6 cm steel rectangles with a pattern of holes drilled into it, then hardened.  For use in creating or repairing hardened lamellar armor.
//: An individual lamella is roughly 3cm x 6cm x 1mm in size.

description: A set of small metal rings, suitable for constructing chainmail.

//: link weighs 1/3 gram or so, make 425 per 150 gram wire to account for loss
description: A set of small metal rings, suitable for constructing chainmail.
A mixture of oxygen and nitrogen in proportions suitable for sustaining divers.
A dry chemical solution effective at extinguishing fires.
A noxious aerosolized irritant used to fend off attackers both human and bear alike.
Flammable material, finely divided for easy combustion.
A plastic die used to play various role-playing games.
A metal die used to play various role-playing games.
Some decent-sized chunks of scrap bronze, for fashioning some old-school items.
//: 300g / 8.8g/ml = ~34.1ml. Add 10% to take an uneven chunk into account = 37.5ml rounded upwards to 38ml.

description: A mix of blue dye, base catalyst, and diphenyl oxalate used in glowsticks.
Graphite powder mixed with a clay binder.  Produces gray or black marks that are easily erased, but otherwise resistant to moisture, most chemicals, ultraviolet radiation, and natural aging.
Carbon black pigment infused with polymers, stabilizers, and water to help the ink flow properly.
Prussian blue, crystal violet, and phthalocyanine blue pigments infused with polymers, stabilizers, and water to help the ink flow properly.
Chlorophyll pigment infused with polymers, stabilizers, and water to help the ink flow properly.
Eosin dye infused with polymers, stabilizers, and water to help the ink flow properly.
A tin of small cone-shaped pellets meant to be used in an air rifle.  Suitable for plinking.
A tin of small cone-shaped pellets meant to be used in an air rifle.  Suitable for hunting small game.
